timeline.message: GitHub Comment issue fix for issue no #235

timeline.bodyText: An integer type is not appropriate here. Either use an enum or, preferably, return a boolean
timeline.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: Please don't declaring variables like this. They should always be declared when they are actually assigned
timeline.author: nikklassen
nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't we be returning some other message in the case where the email isn't sent?
timeline.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText: Mobile is not relying on the back end message . They display the mapped success message that is configured locally. However , let us know if  you still needs some appropriate  message to return.
replies.author: aswinijena100

replies.bodyText:
So the response from this method is
"200 OK" if an email was not sent
and "200 OK, Success" if an email was sent
To me these are the same and don't provide any information. Shouldn't the user be alerted with a failure message if an email wasn't sent?
replies.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText: @nikklassen thanks for highlighting this point. Did the changes now to return an error message in case of failing to trigger an email . please have a look now
replies.author: aswinijena100

timeline.bodyText: This failure code (and the catch) is exactly the same for both methods. Please extract shared logic.
timeline.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText: Already an externalize method is available . However did the change to use the same .
